register.description: Revision Register The Revision Register contains the major and minor revisions for the module.

bitfield.description: MCAN revision version

register.description: Control Register The Control Register contains general control bits for the MCAN module.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Enable
Automatic Wakeup Enable
Wakeup Request Enable
0x0: Disregard debug suspend 0x1: Enable Debug Suspend
If FREE = 0x1: 0x0: debug suspend doesn't wait for Idle 0x1: debug suspend waits for Idle
Clock Fast Ack

Initiates a Soft Reset Note: Software application should complete all pending MCAN services before applying the soft reset. Accesses to MCAN core registers will be stalled until soft reset is completed.

register.description: Status Regsiter The Status register provide general status bits for the MCAN module.

bitfield.description: 0x0: Active 0x1: In transition to Idle 0x2: Idle 0x3: In transition to Active
Enable CAN FD configuration
0x0: Memory Initialization is in progress 0x1: Memory Intialization Done
0x0: Not in reset 0x1: Reset is in progress

register.description: Interrupt Clear Shadow Register Write to clear interrupt bits.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Overflow Interrupt status. Write 1 to clear bits.

register.description: Interrupt Raw Status Register Read raw interrupt status. Write 1 to set interrupt bits.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Overflow Interrupt status.

register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear Shadow Register Write to clear interrupt enable bits.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Overflow Interrupt. Write 1 to clear bits.

register.description: Interrupt Enable Register Read interrupt Enable.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Overflow Interrupt.

register.description: Interrupt Enable Status Read Enabled Interrupts.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Counter Overflow Interrupt.

register.description: End Of Interrupt End of Interrupt Register.

bitfield.description: Write with bit position of targetted interrupt (example: External TS is bit 0). Upon write, level interrupt will clear and if unserviced interrupt counter &gt; 1 will issue another pulse interrupt.

register.description: External Timestamp PreScaler 0 External TImeStamp PreScaler.

bitfield.description: External Timestamp Prescaler reload value. External Timestamp count rate is Host clock (MCAN_ICLK) rate divided by this vlaue.

register.description: External Timestamp PreScaler 0 Unserviced Interrupts Counter External TImeStamp Unserviced Interrupts Counter.

bitfield.description: Number of unserviced rollover interupts. If &gt; 1 an EOI write will issue another pulse interrupt.

register.description: ECC EOI End Of Interrupt for ECC interrupt.

bitfield.description: ECC EOI

register.description: Core Release Register Release dependent constant (version + date).

bitfield.description: Core Release One digit, BCD-coded.
Step of Core Release One digit, BCD-coded.
Sub-step of Core Release One digit, BCD-coded.
Time Stamp Year One digit, BCD-coded.
Time Stamp Month Two digits, BCD-coded.
Time Stamp Day Two digits, BCD-coded.

register.description: Endian Register Constant 0x8765 4321.

bitfield.description: Endianness Test Value The endianness test value is 0x8765 4321.

register.description: Data Bit Timing & Prescaler Register Configuration of data phase bit timing, transmitter delay compensation enable. This register is only writable if the The Therefore the length of the bit time is (programmed values) [

bitfield.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation 0x0: Transmitter Delay Compensation disabled 0x1: Transmitter Delay Compensation enabled

Data Baud Rate Prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 31 (0x00-0x1F). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.
Data time segment before sample point Valid values are 0 to 31 (0x00-0x1F). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.
Data time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 15 (0x0-0xF). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.
Data (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Valid values are 0 to 15 (0x0-0xF). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

register.description: Test Register Test mode selection. Write access to the Test Register has to be enabled by setting the Loop Back Mode and software control of the MCAN_TX pin are hardware test modes. Programming of the

bitfield.description: Receive Pin Monitors the actual value of the MCAN_RX pin 0x0: The CAN bus is dominant (MCAN_RX = 0) 0x1: The CAN bus is recessive (MCAN_RX = 1)

Control of Transmit Pin 0x0: Reset value, the MCAN_TX pin controlled by the CAN Core, updated at the end of the CAN bit time 0x1: Sample Point can be monitored at the MCAN_TX pin 0x2: Dominant (0) level at the MCAN_TX pin 0x3: Recessive (1) at the MCAN_TX pin
Loop Back Mode 0x0: Reset value, Loop Back Mode is disabled 0x1: Loop Back Mode is enabled

register.description: RAM Watchdog Monitors the READY output of the Message RAM. The RAM Watchdog monitors the READY output of the Message RAM. A Message RAM access starts the Message RAM Watchdog Counter with the value configured by the

bitfield.description: Watchdog Value Actual Message RAM Watchdog Counter Value.
Watchdog Configuration Start value of the Message RAM Watchdog Counter. With the reset value of 00 the counter is disabled.

register.description: CC Control Register Operation mode configuration. For details about setting and resetting of single bits, see

bitfield.description: Transmit Pause If this bit is set, the MCAN module pauses for two CAN bit times before starting the next transmission after itself has successfully transmitted a frame 0x0: Transmit pause disabled 0x1: Transmit pause enabled
Edge Filtering during Bus Integration 0x0: Edge filtering disabled 0x1: Two consecutive dominant t
Protocol Exception Handling Disable 0x0: Protocol exception handling enabled 0x1: Protocol exception handling disabled
Bit Rate Switch Enable 0x0: Bit rate switching for transmissions disabled 0x1: Bit rate switching for transmissions enabled
FD Operation Enable 0x0: FD operation disabled 0x1: FD operation enabled
Test Mode Enable 0x0: Normal operation. The 0x1: Test Mode. Write access to the
Disable Automatic Retransmission 0x0: Automatic retransmission of messages not transmitted successfully enabled 0x1: Automatic retransmission disabled
Bus Monitoring Mode The 0x0: Bus Monitoring Mode is disabled 0x1: Bus Monitoring Mode is enabled
Clock Stop Request 0x0: No clock stop is requested 0x1: Clock stop requested. When clock stop is requested, first the
Clock Stop Acknowledge 0x0: No clock stop acknowledged 0x1: The MCAN module may be set in power down by stopping MCAN_ICLK and MCAN_FCLK
Restricted Operation Mode The 0x0: Normal CAN operation 0x1: Restricted Operation Mode active
Configuration Change Enable 0x0: The Host CPU has no write access to the protected configuration registers 0x1: The Host CPU has write access to the protected configuration registers (while the
Initialization 0x0: Normal Operation 0x1: Initialization is started

register.description: Nominal Bit Timing & Prescaler Register Configuration of arbitration phase bit timing. This register is only writable if the Therefore the length of the bit time is (programmed values) [ The Information Processing Time (IPT) is zero, meaning the data for the next bit is available at the first clock edge after the sample point.

bitfield.description: Nominal (Re)Synchronization Jump Width Valid values are 0 to 127 (0x00-0x7F). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.

Nominal Baud Rate Prescaler The value by which the oscillator frequency is divided for generating the bit time quanta. The bit time is built up from a multiple of this quanta. Valid values for the Baud Rate Prescaler are 0 to 511 (0x000-0x1FF). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.
Nominal Time segment before sample point Valid values are 1 to 255 (0x01-0xFF). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.
Nominal Time segment after sample point Valid values are 0 to 127 (0x00-0x7F). The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the programmed value is used.

register.description: Timestamp Counter Configuration Timestamp counter prescaler setting, selection of internal/external timestamp vector. For a description of the Timestamp Counter, see

bitfield.description: Timestamp Counter Prescaler Configures the timestamp and timeout counters time unit in multiples of CAN bit times [1-16 (0x0-0xF)]. The actual interpretation by the hardware of this value is such that one more than the value programmed here is used.
Timestamp Select 0x0: Timestamp counter value always 0x0000 0x1: Timestamp counter value incremented according to the 0x2: External timestamp counter value used 0x3: Same as 00

register.description: Timestamp Counter Value Read/reset timestamp counter.

bitfield.description: Timestamp Counter The internal/external Timestamp Counter value is captured on start of frame (both Rx and Tx). When the [1-16] depending on the configuration of the Write access resets the counter to zero. When the

register.description: Timeout Counter Configuration Configuration of timeout period, selection of timeout counter operation mode. For a description of the Timeout Counter, see

bitfield.description: Timeout Period Start value of the Timeout Counter (down-counter). Configures the Timeout Period.

Timeout Select When operating in Continuous mode, a write to the 0x0: Continuous operation 0x1: Timeout controlled by Tx Event FIFO 0x2: Timeout controlled by Rx FIFO 0 0x3: Timeout controlled by Rx FIFO 1
Enable Timeout Counter 0x0: Timeout Counter disabled 0x1: Timeout Counter enabled

register.description: Timeout Counter Value Read/reset timeout counter.

bitfield.description: Timeout Counter The Timeout Counter is decremented in multiples of CAN bit times [1-16] depending on the configuration of the

register.description: Error Counter Register State of Rx/Tx Error Counter, CAN Error Logging.

bitfield.description: CAN Error Logging The counter is incremented each time when a CAN protocol error causes the Transmit Error Counter or the Receive Error Counter to be incremented. It is reset by read access to the
Receive Error Passive 0x0: The Receive Error Counter is below the error passive level of 128 0x1: The Receive Error Counter has reached the error passive level of 128
Receive Error Counter Actual state of the Receive Error Counter, values between 0 and 127.
Transmit Error Counter Actual state of the Transmit Error Counter, values between 0 and 255.

register.description: Protocol Status Register CAN protocol controller status, transmitter delay compensation value.

bitfield.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation Value Position of the secondary sample point, defined by the sum of the measured delay from the MCAN_TX to MCAN_RX pins and the
Protocol Exception Event 0x0: No protocol exception event occurred since last read access 0x1: Protocol exception event occurred

Received a CAN FD Message This bit is set independent of acceptance filtering. 0x0: Since this bit was reset by the Host CPU, no CAN FD message has been received 0x1: Message in CAN FD format with FDF flag set has been received
BRS flag of last received CAN FD Message This bit is set together with the 0x0: Last received CAN FD message did not have its BRS flag set 0x1: Last received CAN FD message had its BRS flag set
ESI flag of last received CAN FD Message This bit is set together with the 0x0: Last received CAN FD message did not have its ESI flag set 0x1: Last received CAN FD message had its ESI flag set
Data Phase Last Error Code Type of last error that occurred in the data phase of a CAN FD format frame with its BRS flag set. Coding is the same as for the
Bus_Off Status 0x0: The MCAN module is not Bus_Off 0x1: The MCAN module is in Bus_Off state
Warning Status 0x0: Both error counters are below the Error_Warning limit of 96 0x1: At least one of error counter has reached the Error_Warning limit of 96

Error Passive 0x0: The MCAN module is in the Error_Active state. It normally takes part in bus communication and sends an active error flag when an error has been detected 0x1: The MCAN module is in the Error_Passive state

Activity Monitors the module's CAN communication state. 0x0: Synchronizing - node is synchronizing on CAN communication 0x1: Idle - node is neither receiver nor transmitter 0x2: Receiver - node is operating as receiver 0x3: Transmitter - node is operating as transmitter

Last Error Code The 0x0: No Error: No error occurred since the 0x1: Stuff Error: More than 5 equal bits in a sequence have occurred in a part of a received message where this is not allowed. 0x2: Form Error: A fixed format part of a received frame has the wrong format. 0x3: AckError: The message transmitted by the MCAN module was not acknowledged by another node. 0x4: Bit1Error: During the transmission of a message (with the exception of the arbitration field), the device wanted to send a recessive level (bit of logical value 1), but the monitored bus value was dominant. 0x5: Bit0Error: During the transmission of a message (or acknowledge bit, or active error flag, or overload flag), the device wanted to send a dominant level (data or identifier bit logical value 0), but the monitored bus value was recessive. During Bus_Off recovery this status is set each time a sequence of 11 recessive bits has been monitored. This enables the Host CPU to monitor the proceeding of the Bus_Off recovery sequence (indicating the bus is not stuck at dominant or continuously disturbed). 0x6: CRCError: The CRC check sum of a received message was incorrect. The CRC of an incom-ing message does not match with the CRC calculated from the received data. 0x7: NoChange: Any read access to the Protocol Status Register re-initializes the

register.description: Transmitter Delay Comensation Register Configuration of transmitter delay compensation offset and filter window length.

bitfield.description: Transmitter Delay Compensation Offset Offset value defining the distance between the measured delay from the MCAN_RX and MCAN_TX pins and the secondary sample point. Valid values are 0 to 127 mtq (0x00-0x7F).

Transmitter Delay Compensation Filter Window Length Defines the minimum value for the SSP position, dominant edges on the MCAN_RX pin that would result in an earlier SSP position are ignored for transmitter delay measure-ment. The feature is enabled when the

register.description: Interrupt RegisterThe flags are set when one of the listed conditions is detected (edge-sensitive). The flags remain set until the Host CPU clears them. A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. The configuration of the

bitfield.description: Access to Reserved Address 0x0: No access to reserved address occurred 0x1: Access to reserved address occurred
Protocol Error in Data Phase 0x0: No protocol error in data phase 0x1: Protocol error in data phase detected (
Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase 0x0: No protocol error in arbitration phase 0x1: Protocol error in arbitration phase detected (
Watchdog Interrupt 0x0: No Message RAM Watchdog event occurred 0x1: Message RAM Watchdog event due to missing READY
Bus_Off Status 0x0: Bus_Off status unchanged 0x1: Bus_Off status changed
Warning Status 0x0: Error_Warning status unchanged 0x1: Error_Warning status changed
Error Passive 0x0: Error_Passive status unchanged 0x1: Error_Passive status changed
Error Logging Overflow 0x0: CAN Error Logging Counter did not overflow 0x1: Overflow of CAN Error Logging Counter occurred

Bit Error Uncorrected Message RAM bit error detected, uncorrected. Controlled by input signal generated by parity/ECC logic attached to the Message RAM. An uncorrected Message RAM bit error sets the 0x0: No bit error detected when reading from Message RAM 0x1: Bit error detected, uncorrected (example: parity logic)

Bit Error Corrected Message RAM bit error detected and corrected. Controlled by input signal generated by parity/ECC logic attached to the Message RAM. 0x0: No bit error detected when reading from Message RAM 0x1: Bit error detected and corrected (example: ECC)

Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer The flag is set whenever a received message has been stored into a dedicated Rx Buffer. 0x0: No Rx Buffer updated 0x1: At least one received message stored into an Rx Buffer
Timeout Occurred 0x0: No timeout 0x1: Timeout reached

Message RAM Access Failure The flag is set, when the Rx Handler: • has not completed acceptance filtering or storage of an accepted message until the arbitration field of the following message has been received. In this case acceptance filtering or message storage is aborted and the Rx Handler starts processing of the following message. • was not able to write a message to the Message RAM. In this case message storage is aborted. In both cases the FIFO put index is not updated respectively the New Data flag for a dedicated Rx Buffer is not set, a partly stored message is overwritten when the next message is stored to this location. The flag is also set when the Tx Handler was not able to read a message from the Message RAM in time. In this case message transmission is aborted. In case of a Tx Handler access failure the MCAN module is switched into Restricted Operation Mode (see 0x0: No Message RAM access failure occurred 0x1: Message RAM access failure occurred
Timestamp Wraparound 0x0: No timestamp counter wrap-around 0x1: Timestamp counter wrapped around
Tx Event FIFO Element Lost 0x0: No Tx Event FIFO element lost 0x1: Tx Event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size zero
Tx Event FIFO Full 0x0: Tx Event FIFO not full 0x1: Tx Event FIFO full
Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached 0x0: Tx Event FIFO fill level below watermark 0x1: Tx Event FIFO fill level reached watermark
Tx Event FIFO New Entry 0x0: Tx Event FIFO unchanged 0x1: Tx Handler wrote Tx Event FIFO element
Tx FIFO Empty 0x0: Tx FIFO non-empty 0x1: Tx FIFO empty
Transmission Cancellation Finished 0x0: No transmission cancellation finished 0x1: Transmission cancellation finished
Transmission Completed 0x0: No transmission completed 0x1: Transmission completed
High Priority Message 0x0: No high priority message received 0x1: High priority message received
Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost 0x0: No Rx FIFO 1 message lost 0x1: Rx FIFO 1 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 1 of size zero
Rx FIFO 1 Full 0x0: Rx FIFO 1 not full 0x1: Rx FIFO 1 full
Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached 0x0: Rx FIFO 1 fill level below watermark 0x1: Rx FIFO 1 fill level reached watermark
Rx FIFO 1 New Message 0x0: No new message written to Rx FIFO 1 0x1: New message written to Rx FIFO 1
Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost 0x0: No Rx FIFO 0 message lost 0x1: Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size zero
Rx FIFO 0 Full 0x0: Rx FIFO 0 not full 0x1: Rx FIFO 0 full
Rx FIFO 0 Watermark Reached 0x0: Rx FIFO 0 fill level below watermark 0x1: Rx FIFO 0 fill level reached watermark
Rx FIFO 0 New Message 0x0: No new message written to Rx FIFO 0 0x1: New message written to Rx FIFO 0

register.description: Interrupt EnableThe settings in the Interrupt Enable register determine which status changes in the Interrupt Register are signalled on an interrupt line.

bitfield.description: Access to Reserved Address Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Protocol Error in Data Phase Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Watchdog Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Bus_Off Status Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Warning Status Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Error Passive Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Error Logging Overflow Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Bit Error Uncorrected Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Bit Error Corrected Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer Interrupt Enable
Timeout Occurred Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Message RAM Access Failure Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Timestamp Wraparound Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Tx Event FIFO Event Lost Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Tx Event FIFO Full Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Tx Event FIFO New Entry Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Tx FIFO Empty Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Transmission Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Transmission Completed Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
High Priority Message Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 1 Full Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 1 New Message Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 0 Full Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 0 Watermark Reached Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled
Rx FIFO 0 New Message Interrupt Enable 0x0: Interrupt disabled 0x1: Interrupt enabled

register.description: Interrupt Line SelectThe Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via the

bitfield.description: Access to Reserved Address Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Protocol Error in Data Phase Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Protocol Error in Arbitration Phase Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Watchdog Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Bus_Off Status Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Warning Status Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Error Passive Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Error Logging Overflow Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Bit Error Uncorrected Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Bit Error Corrected Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Message stored to Dedicated Rx Buffer Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Timeout Occurred Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Message RAM Access Failure Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Timestamp Wraparound Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1

Tx Event FIFO Full Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Tx Event FIFO Watermark Reached Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Tx Event FIFO New Entry Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Tx FIFO Empty Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Transmission Cancellation Finished Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Transmission Completed Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
High Priority Message Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Rx FIFO 1 Message Lost Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Rx FIFO 1 Full Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Rx FIFO 1 Watermark Reached Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1
Rx FIFO 1 New Message Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1

Rx FIFO 0 New Message Interrupt Line 0x0: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT0 0x1: Interrupt assigned to interrupt line INT1

register.description: Interrupt Line Enable Enable/disable interrupt lines INT0/INT1. Each of the two interrupt lines to the Host CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming the

bitfield.description: Enable Interrupt Line 1 0x0: Interrupt line INT1 disabled 0x1: Interrupt line INT1 enabled
Enable Interrupt Line 0 0x0: Interrupt line INT0 disabled 0x1: Interrupt line INT0 enabled

register.description: Global Filter Configuration Handling of non-matching frames and remote frames. Global settings for Message ID filtering. The Global Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard and extended messages (see

bitfield.description: Accept Non-matching Frames Standard Defines how received messages with 11-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. 0x0: Accept in Rx FIFO 0 0x1: Accept in Rx FIFO 1 0x2: Reject 0x3: Reject

Accept Non-matching Frames Extended Defines how received messages with 29-bit IDs that do not match any element of the filter list are treated. 0x0: Accept in Rx FIFO 0 0x1: Accept in Rx FIFO 1 0x2: Reject 0x3: Reject
Reject Remote Frames Standard 0x0: Filter remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs 0x1: Reject all remote frames with 11-bit standard IDs
Reject Remote Frames Extended 0x0: Filter remote frames with 29-bit extended IDs 0x1: Reject all remote frames with 29-bit extended IDs

register.description: Standard ID Filter Configuration Number of filter elements, pointer to start of filter list. Settings for 11-bit standard Message ID filtering. The Standard ID Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard messages (see

bitfield.description: List Size Standard 0x0: No standard Message ID filter 0x1-0x80 (1-128): Number of standard Message ID filter elements &gt; 0x80 (128): Values greater than 128 are interpreted as 128
Filter List Standard Start Address Start address of standard Message ID filter list (32-bit word address, see

register.description: Extended ID Filter Configuration Number of filter elements, pointer to start of filter list. Settings for 29-bit extended Message ID filtering. The Extended ID Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard messages (see

bitfield.description: List Size Extended 0x0: No extended Message ID filter 0x1-0x40 (1-64): Number of extended Message ID filter elements &gt; 0x40 (64): Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64
Filter List Extended Start Address Start address of extended Message ID filter list (32-bit word address, see

register.description: Extended ID AND Mask 29-bit logical AND mask for J1939.

bitfield.description: Extended ID Mask For acceptance filtering of extended frames the Extended ID AND Mask is ANDed with the Message ID of a received frame. Intended for masking of 29-bit IDs in SAE J1939. With the reset value of all bits set to one the mask is not active.

register.description: High Priority Message Status Status monitoring of incoming high priority messages. This register is updated every time a Message ID filter element configured to generate a priority event matches. This can be used to monitor the status of incoming high priority messages and to enable fast access to these messages.

bitfield.description: Filter List Indicates the filter list of the matching filter element. 0x0: Standard Filter List 0x1: Extended Filter List
Filter Index Index of matching filter element. Range is 0 to
Message Storage Indicator 0x0: No FIFO selected 0x1: FIFO message lost 0x2: Message stored in FIFO 0 0x3: Message stored in FIFO 1
Buffer Index Index of Rx FIFO element to which the message was stored. Only valid when the

register.description: New Data 1 NewDat flags of dedicated Rx buffers 0-31. The register holds the New Data flags of Rx Buffers 0 to 31. The flags are set when the respective Rx Buffer has been updated from a received frame. The flags remain set until the Host CPU clears them. Aflag is cleared by writing a ’1’ to the corresponding bit position. Writing a ’0’ has no effect. Ahard reset will clear the register.

bitfield.description: New Data 0x0: Rx Buffer not updated 0x1: Rx Buffer updated from new message
New Data 0x0: Rx Buffer not updated 0x1: Rx Buffer updated from new message
New Data 0x0: Rx Buffer not updated 0x1: Rx Buffer updated from new message

New Data 0x0: Rx Buffer not updated 0x1: Rx Buffer updated from new message
New Data 0x0: Rx Buffer not updated 0x1: Rx Buffer updated from new message

register.description: New Data 2 NewDat flags of dedicated Rx buffers 32-63. The register holds the New Data flags of Rx Buffers 32 to 63. The flags are set when the respective Rx Buffer has been updated from a received frame. The flags remain set until the Host CPU clears them. Aflag is cleared by writing a ’1’ to the corresponding bit position. Writing a ’0’ has no effect. Ahard reset will clear the register.

register.description: Rx FIFO 0 Configuration FIFO 0 operation mode, watermark, size and start address.

bitfield.description: FIFO 0 Operation Mode FIFO 0 can be operated in blocking or in overwrite mode (see 0x0: FIFO 0 blocking mode 0x1: FIFO 0 overwrite mode
Rx FIFO 0 Watermark 0x0: Watermark interrupt disabled 0x1-0x40 (1-64): Level for Rx FIFO 0 watermark interrupt ( &gt; 0x40 (64): Watermark interrupt disabled
Rx FIFO 0 Size 0x0: No Rx FIFO 0 0x1-0x40 (1-64): Number of Rx FIFO 0 elements &gt; 0x40 (64): Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64 The Rx FIFO 0 elements are indexed from 0 to
Rx FIFO 0 Start Address Start address of Rx FIFO 0 in Message RAM (32-bit word address, see

register.description: Rx FIFO 0 Status FIFO 0 message lost/full indication, put index, get index and fill level.

bitfield.description: Rx FIFO 0 Message Lost This bit is a copy of interrupt flag 0x0: No Rx FIFO 0 message lost 0x1: Rx FIFO 0 message lost, also set after write attempt to Rx FIFO 0 of size zero
Rx FIFO 0 Full 0x0: Rx FIFO 0 not full 0x1: Rx FIFO 0 full
Rx FIFO 0 Put Index Rx FIFO 0 write index pointer, range 0 to 63.
Rx FIFO 0 Get Index Rx FIFO 0 read index pointer, range 0 to 63.
Rx FIFO 0 Fill Level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 0, range 0 to 64.

register.description: Rx FIFO 0 Acknowledge FIFO 0 acknowledge last index of read buffers, updates get index and fill level.

register.description: Rx Buffer Configuration Start address of Rx buffer section.

bitfield.description: Rx Buffer Start Address Configures the start address of the Rx Buffers section in the Message RAM Also used to reference debug messages A,B,C.

register.description: Rx FIFO 1 Configuration FIFO 1 operation mode, watermark, size and start address.

bitfield.description: FIFO 1 Operation Mode FIFO 1 can be operated in blocking or in overwrite mode (see 0x0: FIFO 1 blocking mode 0x1: FIFO 1 overwrite mode

Rx FIFO 1 Size 0x0: No Rx FIFO 1 0x1-0x40 (1-64): Number of Rx FIFO 1 elements &gt; 0x40 (64): Values greater than 64 are interpreted as 64 The Rx FIFO 1 elements are indexed from 0 to
Rx FIFO 1 Start Address Start address of Rx FIFO 1 in Message RAM (32-bit word address, see

register.description: Rx FIFO 1 Status FIFO 1 message lost/full indication, put index, get index and fill level.

bitfield.description: Debug Message Status 0x0: Idle state, wait for reception of debug messages, DMA request is cleared 0x1: Debug message A received 0x2: Debug messages A, B received 0x3: Debug messages A, B, C received,

Rx FIFO 1 Full 0x0: Rx FIFO 1 not full 0x1: Rx FIFO 1 full
Rx FIFO 1 Put Index Rx FIFO 1 write index pointer, range 0 to 63.
Rx FIFO 1 Get Index Rx FIFO 1 read index pointer, range 0 to 63.
Rx FIFO 1 Fill Level Number of elements stored in Rx FIFO 1, range 0 to 64.

register.description: Rx FIFO 1 Acknowledge FIFO 1 acknowledge last index of read buffers, updates get index and fill level.

register.description: Rx Buffer/FIFO Element Size Configuration Configure data field size for storage of accepted frames.

bitfield.description: Rx Buffer Data Field Size 0x0: 8 byte data field 0x1: 12 byte data field 0x2: 16 byte data field 0x3: 20 byte data field 0x4: 24 byte data field 0x5: 32 byte data field 0x6: 48 byte data field 0x7: 64 byte data field

Rx FIFO 1 Data Field Size 0x0: 8 byte data field 0x1: 12 byte data field 0x2: 16 byte data field 0x3: 20 byte data field 0x4: 24 byte data field 0x5: 32 byte data field 0x6: 48 byte data field 0x7: 64 byte data field

register.description: Tx Buffer Configuration Configure Tx FIFO/Queue mode, Tx FIFO/Queue size, number of dedicated Tx buffers, Tx buffer start address.

bitfield.description: Tx FIFO/Queue Mode 0x0: Tx FIFO operation 0x1: Tx Queue operation
Transmit FIFO/Queue Size 0x0: No Tx FIFO/Queue 0x1-0x20 (1-32): Number of Tx Buffers used for Tx FIFO/Queue &gt; 0x20 (32): Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32
Number of Dedicated Transmit Buffers 0x0: No Dedicated Tx Buffers 0x1-0x20 (1-32): Number of Dedicated Tx Buffers &gt; 0x20 (32): Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32

register.description: Tx Buffer Element Size Configuration Configure data field size for frame transmission. Configures the number of data bytes belonging to a Tx Buffer element. Data field sizes > 8 bytes are intended for CAN FD operation only.

bitfield.description: Tx Buffer Data Field Size 0x0: 8 byte data field 0x1: 12 byte data field 0x2: 16 byte data field 0x3: 20 byte data field 0x4: 24 byte data field 0x5: 32 byte data field 0x6: 48 byte data field 0x7: 64 byte data field

register.description: Tx Buffer Request Pending Tx buffers with pending transmission request. Each Tx Buffer has its own Transmission Request Pending bit. The bits are set via the The A cancellation request resets the corresponding transmission request pending bit of register the After a cancellation has been requested, a finished cancellation is signalled via the • after successful transmission together with the corresponding • when the transmission has not yet been started at the point of cancellation • when the transmission has been aborted due to lost arbitration • when an error occurred during frame transmission In DAR mode all transmissions are automatically cancelled if they are not successful. The corresponding

register.description: Tx Event FIFO Configuration Tx event FIFO watermark, size and start address.

bitfield.description: Event FIFO Watermark 0x0: Watermark interrupt disabled 0x1-0x20 (1-32): Level for Tx Event FIFO watermark interrupt ( &gt; 0x20 (32): Watermark interrupt disabled

Event FIFO Size 0x0: Tx Event FIFO disabled 0x1-0x20 (1-32): Number of Tx Event FIFO elements &gt; 0x20 (32): Values greater than 32 are interpreted as 32 The Tx Event FIFO elements are indexed from 0 to
Event FIFO Start Address Start address of Tx Event FIFO in Message RAM (32-bit word address, see

register.description: Tx Event FIFO Status Tx event FIFO element lost/full indication, put index, get index, and fill level.

bitfield.description: This bit is a copy of interrupt flag 0x0: No Tx Event FIFO element lost 0x1: Tx Event FIFO element lost, also set after write attempt to Tx Event FIFO of size zero.
Event FIFO Full 0x0: Tx Event FIFO not full 0x1: Tx Event FIFO full
Event FIFO Put Index Tx Event FIFO write index pointer, range 0 to 31.
Event FIFO Get Index Tx Event FIFO read index pointer, range 0 to 31.
Event FIFO Fill Level Number of elements stored in Tx Event FIFO, range 0 to 32.

register.description: Tx Event FIFO Acknowledge Tx event FIFO acknowledge last index of read elements, updates get index and fill level.

bitfield.description: After the Host CPU has read an element or a sequence of elements from the Tx Event FIFO it has to write the index of the last element read from Tx Event FIFO to the

register.description: ECC Vector Register ECC Vector Register.

bitfield.description: Status to indicate if read is complete
Read address

register.description: Misc Status Misc Status.

bitfield.description: Indicates the number of RAMS serviced by the ECC aggregator

register.description: ECC Control ECC Control Register.

bitfield.description: Force Error only once
Force Error on any RAM read
Force Double Bit Error
Force Single Bit Error
Enable RMW
Enable ECC check
Enable ECC

register.description: ECC Error Control1 Register ECC Error Control1 Register.

bitfield.description: Data bit that needs to be flipped when FORCE_SEC is set
Row address where single or double-bit error needs to be applied. This is ignored if FORCE_N_ROW is set.

register.description: ECC Error Control2 Register ECC Error Control2 Register.

bitfield.description: Data bit that needs to be flipped if double bit error needs to be forced

register.description: ECC Error Status1 Register ECC Error Status1 Register.

bitfield.description: Row address where the single or double-bit error has occurred
Clear Double Bit Error Status
Clear Single Bit Error Status
Level Double Bit Error Status
Level Single Bit Error Status

register.description: ECC Error Status2 Register ECC Error Status2 Register.

bitfield.description: Data bit that corresponds to the double-bit error
Data bit that corresponds to the single-bit error
